term.name: Mohism
term.source: From the name of the Chinese philosopher Mozi (440–360 BCE).
term.def: A school of philosophy that influenced &taoism;. It rivaled &legalism;, &confucianism;, and &yangism;, the three other popular philosophies at the time. Mohism held &altruism; as one of its highest virtues, and strongly rejected &fatalism;.
